text: Donald Trump emerging triumphant at last
month's Republican Party convention
where he was formally nominated as the
party's candidate to run for the
presidency but since then a series of
gaffes and yet more controversies have
led to a barrage of attacks on him
threatening to undermine his campaign
the most recent a damning letter signed
by 50 former national security experts
who say none of them will vote for
Donald Trump from a foreign policy
perspective they say Donald Trump is not
qualified to be president and
commander-in-chief indeed they say they
are convinced he would be a dangerous
president and would put at risk the
country's national security and
well-being amongst those who sign this
letter was the former head of the CIA
Michael Hayden and the former homeland
security chief Tom Ridge all 50
signatories served in Republican
administrations from Richard Nixon to
George W Bush what we wanted to do is
offer the opinion of 50 people who have
actually dealt with the real reality of
serving a president in periods of crisis
war and handling diplomacy and all 50 of
them say when it comes to reality
instead of reality TV Donald Trump is
simply not qualified to be considered as
a future president one Republican Evan
McMullen who used to work for the CIA is
so concerned about Donald Trump running
for president that he's put himself
forward as a replacement candidate
Donald Trump has quickly hit back hard
at his critics calling him part of the
failed Washington elite who made the
disastrous decisions to invade Iraq but
the pressure is now mounting on him from
many different quarters including the
opinion polls which put the Democratic
candidate Hillary Clinton well ahead
Richard Galpin BBC news well let's
discuss this for the next few minutes
with Julie Ann Thompson a conservative
Republican commentator and a trump
supporter she joins me from
Atlanta and the Washington Post
correspondent Mary Jordan Jordan joins
me from Washington she's one of the
reporters that worked on a new book on
Donald Trump fact-checking what he said
thanks to both of you for being here
with us Julianne to you first of all
your reaction to this open letter well
it's it's a scathing letter absolutely
no doubt about that and I have a great
deal of respect for the men that and
women that wrote the letter of their
reputations are stellar and and although
I do have a great deal of respect for
them I certainly disagree with their
assessment although I do believe that
Donald Trump at times is undiplomatic in
the way that he puts things I don't
think that a lot of the powers-that-be
in Washington including these experts
really have any sort of understanding
about the political climate that we're
in and in the current political climate
when national security is at the
forefront of everyone's mind as it is in
2016 people are less concerned about
diplomacy and more concerned about
safety and I think if you ask the
average American voter they will tell
you it was not Donald Trump who was on
watch when our ambassador and when our
CIA contractors were killed in Benghazi
okay I'll come back to that point in a
moment but let me put to you the
Republican candidate is questioned
whether the US should honor its
commitment to NATO he's endorsed the use
of torture suggested that South Korea
and Japan should armed themselves with
nuclear weapons when those 50 advisers
say he's reckless they're on the money I
mean I've just read three of the things
I could have read more and I understand
and I also have concerns with some of
his policies but I think that we're in a
political climate in the United States
on both sides of the aisle whether it's
the left or the right when there is not
an overwhelming amount of support for
either candidate and so people are now
trying to choose who they believe will
keep them the most safe okay Mary Jordan
let me bring you in how damaging do you
think a letter like this is likely to be
horrible this has been the worst week of
the whole campaign for Donald Trump his
poll numbers are are falling and while
the letter itself which is pretty bad I
mean
there are key people saying that he's
reckless and dangerous it comes on the
heels of a lot of mistakes and when I'm
talking to voters when pollsters are
surveying thousands of them they're
seeing that something's happening people
are kind of saying you know what I think
he's just too much of a loose cannon and
I don't think I can vote for him how
unique is what is currently going on
within the Republican Party senior
figures distancing themselves making it
very public and and publishing details
like they have today it is nothing less
than extraordinary we have never seen
anything like this and it's so bad that
the base of the party is basically
deserting the nominee that many people
wonder what's going to happen to the
Americans two-party system I mean for as
long as we've known it it's been the
Republicans and the Democrats what is a
Republican now these Republicans don't
like the guy at the top of the ticket
and many people think the whole party
could disintegrate I'll come back to
Julian in a minute but just on this new
book on Donald Trump and that exercise
of fact-checking wow that's that some
job tell me what that was like well I
mean every day you have a new thing to
fact-check because Donald Trump is
famous and people actually adore him his
followers adore that he shoots from the
hip but when he does that you know he
sometimes makes up the facts and then he
says when you go back to him well I
didn't mean it exactly you know he kind
of left and some of the voters are okay
with that you know he said things like
I'm going to build this 2,000 mile wall
and some people say you know he doesn't
really mean that he just means it's
going to be tough on immigration so it's
hard to fact-check him because even when
you go back to him and you say did you
really mean that he sometimes says it's
more like a feeling than an actual fact
briefly it is extremely effective we saw
a similar thing with the brexit debate
where people just would dismiss
inconvenient faxes project fear he does
the same by saying well that's just the
establishment elite or an establishment
controversy it is incredibly effective
is a tool yes but what what something's
happening in the last week where people
are suddenly saying we know what we want
more specifics we're now entering the
final leg finally people are going to go
to vote in November and and people are
focusing in a different way and
demanding some specifics Julian let me
bring you back in just in terms of what
Mary was saying in terms of the support
base I mean is that growing is he
managing to widen the support to that
the people he needs to actually pull on
board for for November or is it getting
narrow with the sorts of missteps we've
seen over the past 10 days well I
certainly agree with Mary when it comes
to the fact that he needs to be specific
there needs to be more substance
absolutely no doubt about that people
have been asking for that for quite some
time but where I will disagree is with
the comment that the base is deserting
the nominee there is no doubt that there
is division among the leadership of the
Republican Party but among the
rank-and-file voters and activists they
are united behind Donald Trump in
contrast to the Democrats where
leadership is very much behind Hillary
Clinton but the rank-and-file voters and
activists are split and so I think you
have two different situations there of
dissatisfaction but given the current
circumstances and when it comes to to
leadership and when it comes to the
activist base of the Republican Party
who is actually going to get out and
vote I think we're sitting in a better
position and on that point I mean many
people make the point that politics
certainly in Europe seems to have
changed it's changing in America do you
think people have actually caught up
with perhaps as a different driver
different rules that play this time
around I don't think that they trust the
status quo I think people have had
enough of politicians who campaign one
way and govern another and it is that
fact and then you add to that the
financial disaster that is Obamacare and
other things that terrorism national
security and all of these things have
worked together to build a perfect storm
that has made a candidate who ordinarily
would not be successful in a Republican
primary or in the general election like
Donald Trump very successful this time
around a quick final question to marry
Jordan is there any truth in that this
is a Capitol Hill a Washington bubble
and actually what the electorate the ki
electorate for Donald Trump is all about
it our a few states and the disaffected
there and and those people are listening
to him I've spent a lot of time in those
battleground states it's really going to
be won in places like Ohio where I just
spent some time it comes down to two
people yes they want change and that's
Hillary Clinton's problem she's the same
old thing we've had but the new thing
here is people are now saying maybe
Donald Trump is a little too scary a
little too reckless so in November it's
going to come down to are we going to go
back to the same old thing that we're
not that happy with or are we going to
take a chance on this guy who could be
dangerous and that's where you're going
to get the split and right now the math
is that Hillary Clinton will win if the
election we're now but of course there's
time until November
